tsmule.sampling package¶

Submodules¶

tsmule.sampling.perturb module¶

Module to generate samples through perturbation.

class tsmule.sampling.perturb.AbstractPerturbation(**kwargs)¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract Pertubation with abstract methods.

abstract perturb(ts, segments)¶

Perturb a time series to create new sample with same shape.

Parameters

  • ts – (np.array) A time series must be (n_steps, n_features)

  • segments – (np.array) A segments with labels of the time series must be (n_steps, n_features)

Yields

Generator – tuple of (new sample, on/off segments, similarity to original)

class tsmule.sampling.perturb.Perturbation(p_off=0.5, method='zeros', n_samples=10)¶

Bases: tsmule.sampling.perturb.AbstractPerturbation

Base Perturbation module.

classmethod get_sample(x, segm, r=None, p_off=0.5)¶

Get sample of x based on replace segments of x with r.

Parameters

  • x (ndarray) – A multivariate time series

  • segm (ndarray) – A segmentation of x, having same shape with x

  • r (ndarray) – A replacements of x when create a new sample

  • p_off (float, optional) – Probility of disabling a segmentation. Defaults to 0.5.

Yields

Generator – a tuple of (new sample, on/off segments, similarity to original)

classmethod get_samples(x, segm, replace_method='zeros', p_off=0.5, n_samples=10)¶

Perturb and generate sample sets from given time series and its segmentation.

Parameters

  • ts (np.ndarray) – A time series with shape (n_steps, n_features)

  • segments (np.ndarray) – A segmentation of the time series with shape (n_steps, n_features)

  • replace_method (str) – Method to replace off/disabled segment

  • p_off (float) – Probability of disabling a segment. Default is 0.5

  • n_samples (int) – Number of samples to be generated.

Yields

Generator – tuples of (new sample, on/off segments, similarity to original)

perturb(ts, segments)¶

Perturb and generate sample sets from given time series and its segmentation.

Parameters

  • ts (np.ndarray) – A time series with shape (n_steps, n_features)

  • segments (np.ndarray) – A segmentation of the time series with shape (n_steps, n_features)

Yields

Generator – tuple of (new sample, on/off segments, similarity to original)

tsmule.sampling.replace module¶

Calculate replacements for a time series.

tsmule.sampling.replace.global_mean(x, *_args, **_kwargs)¶

Global mean replacements for each segments.

Parameters

x (ndarray) – a time series with any shape.

Returns

the average of whole x per feature.

Return type

ndarray

Global noise for each segments.

Parameters

x (ndarray) – a time series with any shape.

Returns

the average per feature in x.

Return type

ndarray

Inverse max replacement.

Parameters

x (ndarray) – a time series with any shape.

Returns

the average per segment per feature in x.

Return type

tsmule.sampling.replace.inverse_mean(x, *_args, **_kwargs)¶

Inverse mean replacement.

Parameters

x (ndarray) – a time series with any shape.

Returns

the inversed average per feature in x.

ndarray

tsmule.sampling.replace.local_mean(x, segments, *_args, **_kwargs)¶

Local mean replacements for each segments.

Parameters

  • x (ndarray) – a time series with any shape.

  • segments (ndarray) – Segmentation of the time series. Same shape with x.

Returns

the average per segment per feature in x.

Return type

ndarray

  • segments (ndarray) – Segmentation of the time series. Same shape with x.

tsmule.sampling.segment module¶

Segmentation for time series.

class tsmule.sampling.segment.AbstractSegmentation¶

Bases: abc.ABC

Abstract Segmentation with abstract methods.

abstract segment(time_series_sample)¶

Time series instance segmentation into segments.

Parameters

time_series_sample (ndarray) – Time series data (n_steps, n_features)

Returns

the segmentation mask of a time series.

It has the same shape with time series sample.

Return type

segmentation_mask

class tsmule.sampling.segment.MatrixProfileSegmentation(partitions, win_length=3)¶

Bases: tsmule.sampling.segment.AbstractSegmentation

Matrix Profile Segmentation using a matrix profile on every feature.

segment(time_series_sample, segmentation_method='slopes-min')¶

Time series instance segmentation into segments.

Currently only with slopes but more is planned.

Parameters

  • time_series_sample (ndarray) – Time series data (n_steps, n_features)

  • segmentation_method (str, optional) – Segmentation method to be used. Defaults to ‘slopes-min’. Possible: slopes-min | slopes-max | bins-min | bins-max

Returns

the segmentation mask of a time series.

It has the same shape with time series sample.

Return type

segmentation_mask

class tsmule.sampling.segment.SAXSegmentation(partitions)¶

Bases: tsmule.sampling.segment.AbstractSegmentation

SAX Segmentation using a on every feature.

segment(time_series_sample, **_kwargs)¶

Time series instance segmentation into segments.

Idea:

  • Segment data using the SAX transformation.

  • Use SAX to transform data.

  • Use transformed data to identify windows.

Parameters

time_series_sample (ndarray) – Time series data (n_steps, n_features)

Returns

the segmentation mask of a time series. It has the same shape with time series sample.

Return type

segmentation_mask

class tsmule.sampling.segment.SegmentationPicker¶

Bases: object

Picker for segmentation method.

static select(method, partitions, win_length=0)¶

Construct a segmentation method family.

Parameters

  • method (str) – Segmentation method family, either ‘sax’, ‘window’ or ‘matrix’.

  • partitions (int) – number of partitions.

  • win_length (int, optional) – Window length. Defaults to 0.

Returns

An instance of AbstractSegmentation

Return type

object

class tsmule.sampling.segment.WindowSegmentation(partitions, win_length=3)¶

Bases: tsmule.sampling.segment.AbstractSegmentation

Windows segmentation with non-overlapping windows.

segment(time_series_sample, segmentation_method='uniform')¶

Time series instance segmentation into segments.

Parameters

  • time_series_sample (ndarray) – Time series data (n_steps, n_features)

  • segmentation_method (str, optional) – Segmentation method to be used. Defaults to ‘uniform’. Possible: uniform | exponential

Returns

the segmentation mask of a time series. It has the same shape with time series sample.

Return type

segmentation_mask
